children.name: heading_color
children.label: Heading Color
children.help_text: This will be use as he default color for the primary buttons and links.

children.name: body_color
children.label: Body Color
children.help_text: This will be use as he default color for the primary buttons and links.

children.name: primary
children.label: Primary Color
children.help_text: This will be the default color for all the text on the website.

children.name: secondary
children.label: Secondary Color
children.help_text: This will be the color of the secondary button and tertiary by default.

children.name: tertiary
children.label: Tertiary Color
children.help_text: This will be use as he default color for the primary buttons and links.

children.name: em_tier
children.label: REM Font Level:
children.help_text: Generally speaking, the larger the font the goofier the links will look, so use good judgement.

children.name: line_height
children.label: Line Height (em)
children.help_text: This will set the space between lines of text. Generally, you'll want to keep this number between 1 and 1.8 for maximum readability.

children.name: letter_spacing
children.label: Letter Spacing (em)
children.help_text: This option will create space between each character. The numbers are set in em so use sparingly to avoid goofy looking text

children.name: space_between
children.label: Space Between
children.help_text: This will give you the power to increase or decrease the spacing between each Link in the navigation bar.

children.name: secondary_header_reveal
children.label: Reveal header on scroll up
children.help_text: If selected the header will reveal when the user scrolls up towards the top of the page

children.name: header_menu_display
children.label: Menu Visibility
children.help_text: Use this to hide navigation for landing pages.

children.name: search_icon_display
children.label: Search Icon Visibility
children.help_text: Toggle to hide or show magnifying glass in the header.

children.name: cta_button_main
children.label: Main CTA
children.help_text: Styling for the primary header CTA displayed to the far right on the header on desktop.

children.name: cta_button_secondary
children.label: Secondary CTA
children.help_text: Styling for the secondary header CTA displayed to left of the primary CTA.

children.name: top_bottom_padding
children.label: Top and Bottom Padding (px)
children.help_text: Use this to increase or decrease the space above and below the elements inside the header.

children.name: logo_size
children.label: Logo Size (px)
children.help_text: Use this as max size of the logo without affecting the ratio of the image

children.name: logo_mobile
children.label: Logo Size (Mobile px)
children.help_text: Use this as max size of the logo without affecting the ratio of the image

children.label: Use Custom Fonts
children.name: custom_font
children.help_text: If you want to add a custom font, upload the font files on hubspot and then follow the instructions inside custom_typography.css file

children.name: primary
children.label: Primary font
children.help_text: This will be the default font family for all the text on the pages but the headings

children.name: secondary
children.label: Secondary font
children.help_text: This will be the default font family for all the headings, update this before overriding any speficic heading

children.name: line_height
children.label: Line Height (em)
children.help_text: This will set the space between lines of text. Generally, you'll want to keep this number between 1 and 1.8 for maximum readability.

children.name: margin_bottom
children.label: Margin Bottom (em)
children.help_text: Use this to increase or decrease the spacing below on this element

children.name: letter_spacing
children.label: Letter Spacing (em)
children.help_text: This option will create space between each character. The numbers are set in em so use sparingly to avoid goofy looking text

children.name: em_tier
children.label: REM Font Level:
children.help_text: Set the position in levels up or down the EM scale you would like the text to be. 0 is no adjustment, +2 is two steps larger than base font (ie. equal to heading 5), -2 is two steps smaller than base font (ie. 16px font would now be 10px with an EM scale of 1.25)

children.name: border_width
children.label: Border Width (px)
children.help_text: This will let you set the width of the border.

children.name: text_indent
children.label: Text Indent (em)
children.help_text: Use this to increase or decrease indentation of the blockquote

children.name: em_tier

children.help_text: Set the position in levels up or down the EM scale you would like the text to be. 0 is no adjustment, +2 is two steps larger than base font (ie. equal to heading 5), -2 is two steps smaller than base font (ie. 16px font would now be 10px with an EM scale of 1.25)

children.help_text: Use this to increase or decrease the spacing between list elements
